Text:
In the dark, Cid hears a voice and turns. Out of the
corner of his eye, he sees a boy who is being held
captive with Anna, holding a wooden club.
(Why is he doing thisâ€”?!)

There are definitely tears in his eyes. His face is
tinged with fear and anger. What prompted him to
do such a horrible thing?

Before she can react, the boy swings with rage.
He does not strike Beatrix, though. She hears a
dull thud, but the sound is none other than...
Ow...! That hurt...!
Cid! Y-You protected me...? That's so reckless...

H-Haha....my body acted on its own. Forget about me,
that boy is...
(Cid is right.)
Why did you do that? What are you...?
Urk... I-I have no other choice...
(No other choice? What does he mean?)

At that moment the sound of clapping rings out in the
cellar, and a man appears from the darkness. He has
a sly smile and seems to be one of the kidnappers.
Atta boy. You're just like one of us.

Youâ€¦! I see how it is. You're the one forcing him
to do this.

Huh? He did it all by himself! He wants to do it,
and he's a big help. Aren't you, boy?

B-Because if I don't, they'll sell me off... And I'd
just get killed right away... So that's why...I'm...!

(How dare he! He kidnapped a young boy, threatened
him, and forced him to do something so awful!)
You wretched...

Hold it! Don't move! You know what'll happen to the
girl if you make any sudden movements, right?
...You monster.
Bwahaha! How nice of you!

(What should I do...? Since he's using Anna as
a shield, I can't attack him head-on.)

Hey, you. Scrawny guy over there...Tie her up.
Use the rope in the box behind you.
H-Huh...?! Th-There's no way I can do that!
Shut up! Hurry up and do it! Do you wanna die too?!
...I don't mind, Cid. Just do as he says.
Wh-What...

(Think, Beatrix... There must be something, some way
to get that man away from Anna.  I need an opening!)

U-Um, is this the rope? It's kind of dirty and tangled
up all over the place...

Stop wasting time! Just tie her up!
I don't care how!
(What should I do? How can I help those kids...?!)

So if I untie it here... Urk, it's stuck, the knot's
too tight to untie...
What the hell are you doing?!
Argh...! I'm telling you, it's impossible to...huh?!
Huh?!

As Cid forcibly pulls the knot apart, the end of the
rope suddenly slips from his hands and whips the
kidnapper in the face. The man crouches and
covers his eyes instinctively.
(Now's my chance...! I won't waste it!)
Anna...and you! Come here!
C-Crap...! My eyes...! What are you trying to pull?!
M-My bad.
You've got some nerve! I'll murder you!
If only you could.

Beatrix points her sword at the kidnapper, who seems
to have finally regained his vision. His face distorts
in fear.
It shouldn't have been...this awful for the children!
Gugyaaagh!!!

After that, they immediately contact the Knight
Order and turn in the two kidnappers.

The men seem to have kidnapped the boy and forced him
to help them commit a string of crimes.

The Knight Order has been mobilized to try and find
the route used by the traffickers, and destroy it.

Anna was returned safely to her mother.
As for the boy...

Don't worry, the State will take care of you for now.
They'll locate your parents for you soon, so there's
no need to be frightened anymore.

I...I hated it! I didn't really want to help with the
kidnapping...but...I thought if I stayed there,
I might be able to go home one day...
You did great...being all by yourself.
I'm so sorry for hitting you!
I'm fine, haha... Just a tiny bump on my head...

Cid rubs his head, confirming that there is, indeed,
a slight bump on it.

...We can rest for now. I'm glad...we could
solve the kidnapping.
True... That sure was terrifying, though...

(All things considered, he seemed relaxed when he
faced the kidnappers and when he protected me...)

(As always, I don't know what he's thinking,
but in any case...)
You should at least learn how to break your fall...
Huh...? Nah, It's not like I can do it anyway.

Cid speaks in his usual tone. He sounds disinterested,
and Beatrix thinks she may have been mistaken to
assume that he had any hidden talents.

While chasing the kidnappers, Cid saved her numerous
times. She thought it was a coincidence at first, but the
second time made her think again. How many times
can coincidence happen before it becomes planned?

(If I tell myself it's foolishness, I can almost believe
it...)

Try not to fall down anymore.. No, I can at least
teach you how to protect yourself from getting
hit in the head with wooden clubs.

Nah, I'll pass. I'm really not good at
that kind of thing, and besides...

If you poorly avoid someone's attack,
it can just make them angry.

(Did Cid get hit by the boy on purpose...? And in
doing so, did he lure the kidnapper into letting his
guard down?)

(That man wasn't cautious of Cid from the start.
Was it because Cid managed to portray himself
as weak enough to get struck by a child...?)

(Conversely, if Cid had dodged the boy's strike and
was unharmed, the kidnapper might not have shown
himself so easily and we may have both been tied up.)

(In any case, there's no doubt that there would have
been a stalemate. Could it really all be coincidence?)

When she looks up, Cid is watching the sunset with
a dejected smile on his face.

My sister always gets mad at me for the same thing.
Like, "Don't run away!"
Cid, are you...

All right, I'm outta here. I really have to get back,
especially with my curfew and all.
Ah, waitâ€”!

Perhaps not hearing her words, Cid's silhouette grows
fainter and fainter as he runs, vanishing into the
labyrinth of the city.
(He's lightning quick only at times like these...)

(Cid...you're a strange guy. You'll...definitely
become stronger. My eyes never deceive me.)
(I'll get stronger too.)

She knows that day will eventually come. Having made
up her mind, Beatrix laughs softly.
